author: @kctv5
title: 96-year-old handwrites 8,000 Christmas cards to military members
text:
MCPHERSON, Kan. (KAKE) â€“ A 96-year-old Kansas woman isnâ€™t letting her age stop her from spreading holiday cheer in a big way.
For the last few years, Mary Peterson has hand written thousands of greeting cards and sent them to members of the military who cannot make it home to be with their families.
Peterson said the first year, she sent 7,000 Christmas cards. By this year, she increased her numbers to 8,000.
Since she started in 2020, Peterson has sent 24,000 cards to military members all around the world.
Peterson said when she was in high school, her older brother served overseas, and she wrote to him every single week.
Later, her husband fought in World War II, so she knows very well how lonely the holidays can be for people in the military.
â€œThereâ€™s so many heartaches and broken homes and people went to the service because it was something else for them to do. And they wonâ€™t hear from family because theyâ€™ve lost their connection,â€ Peterson said.
Thankfully, the community members help Peterson by donating thousands of blank holiday cards for her to write in. After sheâ€™s done filling them out, Peterson takes them to the Fort Riley base, where they then get sent out to active-duty members in different parts of the world.
Each card shares the same sweet message: â€œGod bless you and keep you safe. That is my prayer for you. Grandma Mary, McPherson, Kansas.â€
Peterson said she averages writing about 50 cards per day, which means she has to start mid-summer to get them done in time.
The 96-year-old said as long as God keeps her hand steady enough to write in beautiful cursive, sheâ€™ll never stop sending these letters.
â€œI hope that makes them realize that thereâ€™s somebody that still loves them and loves what theyâ€™re doing,â€ Peterson said.

author: Melisa Merlos
title: 3 niÃ±as venezolanas murieron al caer de un tren en Lerdo, investigan homicidio culposo | El Heraldo de MÃ©xico
text: 2 pequeÃ±as niÃ±as migrantes de 2 y 4 aÃ±os de edad cayeron de un tren en movimiento en la comunidad de Villa Nazareno, en [Lerdo](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/elecciones/2024/4/24/video-en-municipio-priista-de-lerdo-durango-denuncian-agresiones-por-pintar-bardas-de-otros-partidos-597163.html), Durango, ambas perdieron la vida. SegÃºn las autoridades el caso se investigarÃ¡ como homicidio culposo, las menores identificadas como Kailany Daniela de 4 aÃ±os y Aylana Angely de 2 aÃ±os, perdieron el equilibrio cuando el tren se puso en marcha. El tren se dirigÃ­a a la frontera con Estados Unidos, por lo que se presume intentarÃ­an cruzar al otro lado. SegÃºn medios locales, la FiscalÃ­a General del Estado de Durango, asegura que lo ocurrido serÃ¡ investigado como homicidio culposo, supuestamente sus padres las intentaron subir al tren en movimiento en la comunidad de Nazareno. En una conferencia de prensa, Juan Francisco Ãngeles Zapata, Vicefiscal en La Laguna de Durango, informÃ³ que ya se iniciÃ³ la carpeta de investigaciÃ³n a fin de determinar la responsabilidad de alguna persona. Sigue leyendo: [VIDEO: En municipio priista de Lerdo, Durango, denuncian agresiones por pintar bardas de otros partidos](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/elecciones/2024/4/24/video-en-municipio-priista-de-lerdo-durango-denuncian-agresiones-por-pintar-bardas-de-otros-partidos-597163.html) [ApuÃ±alan a abuelito en Durango; reconoce al agresor porque era su vecino](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/4/24/apunalan-abuelito-en-durango-reconoce-al-agresor-porque-era-su-vecino-597162.html) Â¿La empresa serÃ­a responsable? SegÃºn informaciÃ³n de la FiscalÃ­a, estÃ¡n realizando la investigaciÃ³n, se acordaron las primeras diligencias y se hicieron lo estudios de necropsia, entrevistas y posteriormente la entrega de las dos niÃ±as fallecidas a sus familiares. AdemÃ¡s, precisÃ³ que la denuncia es contra un particular, ya que el motivo de este lamentable suceso se dio a raÃ­z de que intentaron abordar un tren de carga, por lo que no hay responsabilidad para Ferromex. AdemÃ¡s, de acuerdo al protocolo, en caso de los padres migrantes de las dos menores, si se comprueba la comisiÃ³n de algÃºn hecho delictivo, la FiscalÃ­a da vista al Instituto Nacional de MigraciÃ³n y a Derechos Humanos, para que vigilen el buen actuar de cualquier autoridad. Â¿CuÃ¡ntos migrantes entran a MÃ©xico? SegÃºn informaciÃ³n de la SecretarÃ­a de GobernaciÃ³n de MÃ©xico (SEGOB), al menos 686 mil 732 personas se encuentran en situaciÃ³n migratoria irregular y se presentaron ante las autoridades mexicanas al ingresar al paÃ­s entre enero y noviembre de 2023 para solicitar ayuda consular. Y 3 de cada 10 migrantes provienen de CentroamÃ©rica, la mayorÃ­a son venezolanos y ecuatorianos. Quienes buscan refugio ante la creciente ola de violencia que afecta a sus paÃ­ses. Muchos de ellos buscan como destino final Estados Unidos. Esto ha generado crisis entre MÃ©xico y Estados Unidos.

author: amateurgolf.com
title: LIVE SCORING: 2025 Monroe Invitational at Monroe Golf Club
text:
Ty Kaufman of Ave Maria University jumped out to the solo lead after Round 1 with a scorching 5-under 65 at Monroe Golf Club. The junior from Naples, Florida and First Team All-Sun Conference selection is quickly making a name for himself in elite amateur circles. Known for his scoring consistencyâ€”he posted seven rounds of par or better last season and owns two career collegiate winsâ€”Kaufman wasted no time attacking the course.
He opened with five birdies in his first 10 holes and kept his composure on the inward nine to hold a one-shot advantage over a stacked leaderboard. A finance major who helped guide Ave Maria to the 2025 NAIA National Championships, Kaufman continues to build on what is shaping up to be a breakout collegiate career. His precision ball-striking and calm demeanor under pressure were both on display in Wednesdayâ€™s opener.
ðŸ“ View Full Leaderboard
The Monroe Invitational returns to Monroe Golf Club in Pittsford, New York from July 23â€“26, 2025, showcasing one of the strongest amateur fields of the summer. Renowned for its rich history and demanding format, the tournament features 72 holes of stroke play with a 54-hole cut after three rounds. With a collection of elite college and mid-amateur talent competing on a classic Donald Ross design, drama is all but guaranteed.
Founded in 1937, the Monroe Invitational has seen many future stars walk its fairways. Tiger Woods reached the semifinals here in 1993. Recent winners include Dustin Johnson (2007), Thomas Pieters (2012), and Andy Ogletree (2019)â€”each of whom went on to success at the professional level.
LIVE SCORING & RESULTS
Monroe plays to a championship layout of 6,971 yards (Par 70), with long, demanding par 4s and slick, multi-tiered greens. The winning score typically lands between 6 and 10 under, but conditions may push that lower or higher. This yearâ€™s forecast includes calm breezes and firm turfâ€”ideal for low scoring early in the week, but likely to reward precision as the course tightens heading into the weekend.
Defending champion Cooper Smith won in thrilling fashion in 2024, emerging from a four-man playoff after finishing at 7-under. He returns to Rochester looking to defend his title against a loaded field that includes fellow 2024 contenders Carter Loflin, Drew Doyle, and Kyle Downey. With a wave of rising collegiate talent joining them, expect a fierce battle for the Monroe crown.
